intro: Acmella spilanthoides, commonly known as the "spiny false button" or "spiny acmella," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, spiky, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky, latex-like substance that can cause a tingling or burning sensation upon contact. It is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its unique appearance and chemical properties, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a decorative plant.
